summary: This bill, the Artificial Intelligence Accountability Act, directs the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information to conduct a study and hold public meetings on AI accountability measures. The study will analyze how accountability measures are used in various AI systems, including those used by communications networks and spectrum sharing applications. It will also examine how to reduce risks (e.g., cybersecurity), promote digital inclusion, and define “trustworthy” AI. The bill requires a report to Congress with findings and recommendations. Further, the bill mandates public meetings to gather feedback on what information should be available regarding AI systems.
